Función de los Bosques

In wooded areas, the canopy of leaves (the tree canopies) intercepts and gradually redistributes rainwater.

One part of the precipitation then flows through the bark of the trunks and the rest runs off through the branches and foliage.

That slower and less uniform distribution of rain contributes to the soil not being washed away immediately.

In this way, the possibility of flooding and erosion is reduced.
